title: A Comprehensive Guide to Using Bing (Searching, Using + More)

steps.title: Open Bing.
steps.content: Open Bing. Go to www.bing.com in your computer's web browser. Sign in if necessary. If you want to use your Microsoft account with Bing, click Sign in in the top-right side of the page and then enter your Microsoft email address and password. Signing into Bing has a few perks: [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You can view and edit your search history from both the current session and any other computer on which you're signed into Bing. You can adjust settings for your Bing searches. You can earn points toward Bing Rewards.

steps.title: Enter your search query into the search bar and press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Enter your search query into the search bar and press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return . Type in the word or phrase for which you want to search into the text box centered in the browser window.

steps.title: Review the results.
steps.content: Review the results. Scroll down through the list of search results; if you find one you want to select, click it to open it.

steps.title: Organize search results.
steps.content: Organize search results. If you want to see a specific type of search result, you can click any of the following tabs at the top of the search results page: All — Shows all search results. Copilot — Opens a chat with Copilot, which gives you an AI-generated summary of what you searched. Images — Shows only image results. Videos — Shows only video results. Maps — Shows only map-related results. News — Shows only news-categorized results. Shopping — Shows only shopping (e.g., Amazon and eBay) results. More – Find more results, like Flights , Travel , and Hotels . You can also search your local area for your search words.

steps.title: View your Bing search history.
steps.content: View your Bing search history. If you're signed into Bing via your Microsoft account, you can see your searched items: click ☰ in the upper-right corner of the page, then click Search history in the resulting drop-down menu. You can remove items from your Bing search history by clicking View and delete search history near the top of the page, signing into your account, clicking Clear activity , and clicking Clear .

steps.title: Change SafeSearch restrictions.
steps.content: Change SafeSearch restrictions. Again, if you're signed into Bing through your Microsoft account, you can change your search restrictions to enable (or hide) adult content: Click ☰ in the upper-right side of the page. Click SafeSearch in the resulting drop-down menu. Check one of the "SafeSearch" boxes (e.g., to remove SafeSearch restrictions, check "Off"). Click Save at the bottom of the page. Click Agree if prompted.

steps.title: Use Bing Rewards.
steps.content: Use Bing Rewards. When you're signed into Bing, you earn a certain number of points for using Bing to search, using Bing in Microsoft Edge, and so on. You can see a list of current Bing Reward challenges by clicking the trophy icon in the upper-right side of the page. If you earn enough points, you can redeem them for a prize (e.g., a free month of Xbox Live Gold) or use them to enter a raffle for monthly give-aways such as laptops and gaming equipment.

steps.title: Open Bing.
steps.content: Open Bing. Tap OPEN in your smartphone's app store, or tap the Bing app icon. If you don't have it already, download the Microsoft Bing Search app. Bing is available as a free app on both iPhone and Android smartphones: iPhone — Open the App Store , tap Search , tap the search bar, type in bing and tap Search , tap GET next to Bing, and enter your Touch ID or Apple ID password if prompted. Android — Open the Play Store , tap the search icon, tap the search bar, type in bing and tap Search or Enter , tap Bing , tap INSTALL , and tap ACCEPT if prompted.

steps.title: Sign into Bing if necessary.
steps.content: Sign into Bing if necessary. If you want to be able to view and clear your search history and see your Bing Rewards, sign into your Microsoft account by doing the following: Tap the person-shaped icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen (on Android, it's in the top-right corner). Tap Sign in . Enter your email address and phone number.

steps.title: Enter a search query into the search bar and press .
steps.content: Enter a search query into the search bar and press . Type in whatever word or phrase you want to search for, then press the magnifying glass icon on your keyboard to start the search. If you don't want your current search to be saved to your Bing history, first tap the "Private" switch (or "InPrivate" switch on Android) above the keyboard.

steps.title: Review the search results.
steps.content: Review the search results. Scroll through the list of search results to do so; if you see one you want to open, tap it.

steps.title: Organize search results.
steps.content: Organize search results. If you want to see a specific type of search result, you can tap any of the following tabs at the top of the search results page: All — Shows all search results. Copilot — Opens a chat with Copilot, which gives you an AI-generated summary of what you searched. Images — Shows only image results. Videos — Shows only video results. Maps — Shows only map-related results. News — Shows only news-categorized results. Shopping — Shows only shopping (e.g., Amazon and eBay) results. More – Find more results, like Flights , Travel , and Hotels . You can also search your local area for your search words.

steps.title: View your search history.
steps.content: View your search history. If you're signed into Bing, you can see your account's search history by tapping the profile icon in the top left corner of the screen and then tapping History . If you want to clear your smartphone's Bing search history, tap DELETE at the top of the page, then tap Clear search history when prompted.

steps.title: Use Bing Rewards.
steps.content: Use Bing Rewards. When you're signed into Bing, you earn a certain number of points for using Bing to search each day. If you get enough points, you can exchange them for a reward or a raffle entry. You can check your Bing Rewards progress by tapping the profile icon and then tapping My Rewards in the resulting menu.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Click or double-click the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the Chrome window. A drop-down menu will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens the Settings page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Search engine.
steps.content: Click Search engine . It's in the menu on the left and will open more options to the right.

steps.title: Click Change next to your current search engine.
steps.content: Click Change next to your current search engine. If it's already listed as "Bing," you can skip this step.

steps.title: Select "Microsoft Bing" and click Set as default.
steps.content: Select "Microsoft Bing" and click Set as default . Doing so sets Bing as your browser's default search engine; from now on, when you enter a word or phrase into the address bar at the top of the browser, you'll see Bing search results instead of your previous default. Set Bing as the default in the Chrome mobile app. If you want to use Bing as the default Chrome search engine on mobile as well, open Chrome, then do the following: Tap ⋯ (iPhone) or ⋮ (Android). Tap Settings . Tap Search engine . Tap Bing . Tap DONE (iPhone only).

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Click or double-click the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox wrapped around a blue globe.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . This is in the top-right corner of the window. A drop-down menu will appear. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click the Search tab.
steps.content: Click the Search tab. You'll find this on the left side of the window. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Default Search Engine" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Default Search Engine" drop-down box. This option is near the top of the Search page. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Bing.
steps.content: Click Bing . It's in the drop-down menu. Doing so sets Bing as your browser's default search engine; from now on, when you enter a word or phrase into the address bar at the top of the browser, you'll see Bing search results instead of your previous default. Set Bing as the default in the Firefox mobile app. If you want to use Bing as the default Firefox search engine on mobile as well, open Firefox, then do the following: Tap ☰ (iPhone) or ⋮ (Android). Tap Settings in the menu. Tap Search . Tap the current search engine at the top of the screen (iPhone) or Bing (Android). Tap Bing (iPhone) or Set as default (Android).

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. Click the Safari app icon, which resembles a blue compass, in your Mac's Dock.

steps.title: Click the Safari menu tab and click Settings.
steps.content: Click the Safari menu tab and click Settings . The Safari menu tab is in the menu bar at the top of your screen and prompts another menu to drop-down, where you'll find Settings . Clicking Settings opens a new window.

steps.title: Click the Search tab.
steps.content: Click the Search tab. It's a tab at the top of the pop-up window. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Search engine" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Search engine" drop-down box. This is near the top of the window. A drop-down menu will appear. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Bing.
steps.content: Click Bing . It's in the drop-down menu. Doing so sets Bing as your browser's default search engine; from now on, when you enter a word or phrase into the address bar at the top of the browser, you'll see Bing search results instead of your previous default. [9] X Research source Set Bing as the default in the Safari mobile app. If you want to use Bing as the default Safari search engine on your iPhone as well, do the following: Open your iPhone's Settings. Scroll down and tap Safari . Tap Search Engine . Tap Bing .
